Context:
The text provides information about a performing arts program offered by the college. The program is designed for individuals who aspire to pursue a career in theatre or media, be a YouTuber or influencer, or simply want to improve their skills and confidence. Successful graduates may audition for the three-year Theatre Arts – Performance program or the two-year Acting for Media program.

The first semester required courses include THEA 1021: Performing Arts Career, THEA 1022: Performance Styles in Dramatic Literature, THEA 1036: Fundamentals of Acting, COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts, and THEA 1034: Kinetic Movement for Actors.

The second semester required courses are THEA 1023: Introduction to Voice and Speech, THEA 2030: Theatre as Medium, THEA 2033: Monologue and Audition Preparation, THEA 2047: Introduction to Scene Study, and THEA 2040: Creative Process. An additional course, THEA 2042: Career Building Using Social Media, is also mentioned.

The program learning outcomes include the ability to employ improvisational skills for problem-solving and character development, analyze different styles and genres of performance, develop a career and professional development plan, identify career opportunities in the performing arts industry, work collaboratively to prepare and present an interdisciplinary performance, and interact professionally within the industry.

The tuition for domestic students is $4,699.00, and for international students it is $18,120.00 for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023. The fees are subject to change for programs starting at later dates.

No emails or names were mentioned in the text.

Context:
The text provides information about the fees and admission requirements for programs starting in Fall 2024 at George Brown College. The estimated total of tuition, materials, student service, and ancillary fees for the first two semesters is mentioned, but the exact amounts are not provided. Tuition fees are subject to board approval, while material, student service, and ancillary fees are estimated based on prior years. It is important to note that all fees are subject to change without notice and do not include books which students must purchase separately.

The text also mentions that the program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria. Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, including a grade 12 English (C or U). Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve the required credit(s) in English. Course exemptions may be granted based on college or university credits. International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students can contact the School of Media and Performing Arts at 416-415-5000, ext. 2167 or email performingarts@georgebrown.ca for more information. The text includes a disclaimer that the information is subject to change without notice and should not be considered as a representation, offer, or warranty.
